snippet: Investigators do not know, however, if the blaze that is thought to have caused the plane to come apart was an accident or caused by terrorism....
abstract: Evidence amassed in investigation into May crash of EgyptAir Flight 804 in Mediterranean Sea points to likelihood that cockpit fire raged out of control and caused plane to break up in midair; remains unclear whether fire was accidental or intentionally set.

byline.original: By NOUR YOUSSEF and LIAM STACK
byline.contributor: Nicola Clark contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Investigators do not know, however, if the blaze that is thought to have caused the plane to come apart was an accident or caused by terrorism.

headline.main: EgyptAir Flight 804 Broke Up in Midair After a Fire, Evidence Suggests
headline.print_headline: EgyptAir Flight Broke Up in Midair After a Fire, Evidence Suggests
